question.text: Identify the correct sequence of succession in a hydrosere.

options.text: Free-floating hydrophytes, sedges, phytoplankton, rooted hydrophytes, grasses and trees.
Phytoplankton, rooted submerged hydrophytes, floating hydrophytes, reed swamp, marsh meadow and trees.
Phytoplankton, sedges, free-floating hydrophytes, rooted hydrophytes, grasses and trees.
Phytoplankton, free-floating hydrophytes, rooted hydrophytes; sedges, grasses and trees.

solution.text: In the primary succession in water the pioneers are small phytoplanktons, they are replaced with time by rooted submerged plants then by floating hydrophytes, sedges grasses and finally trees. Phytoplanktons are pioneer community and trees are the climax community which at the end becomes stable.
